etymology.description: 癸 depicts a form whose original meaning is uncertain -> associated with measuring tools or setups for determining directions and solstices -> possible original forms of 戣(戣) (kuí, "halberd"), 葵(葵) (kuí, "mallow"), 規(規) (guī, "compass; rule")
etymology.interpretation: The character 癸(癸) (guǐ, "tenth earthly branch") is a pictogram whose depiction is uncertain but is conceptually linked to measurement or orientation tools. These tools were possibly used for solar observations or direction finding, thus lending the character significance in calendrical or positional contexts.

examples.chinese: 在中国古代历法中(在中國古代曆法中)，癸象征着第十个时间段(癸象徵著第十個時間段)。
examples.pinyin: Zài Zhōngguó gǔdài lìfǎ zhōng, guǐ xiàngzhēng zhe dì shí gè shíjiān duàn.
examples.english: In traditional Chinese calendrical systems, guǐ symbolizes the tenth time period.

examples.chinese: 古代学者通过观察天象(古代學者通過觀察天象)，用癸来记录岁月更迭(用癸來記錄歲月更迭)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài xuézhě tōngguò guānchá tiānxiàng, yòng guǐ lái jìlù suìyuè gēngdié.
examples.english: Ancient scholars, by observing celestial phenomena, used guǐ to record the passage of time.

examples.chinese: 天干地支系统里(天干地支系統里)，癸代表第十个地支(癸代表第十個地支)。
examples.pinyin: Tiāngān dìzhī xìtǒng lǐ, guǐ dàibiǎo dì shí gè dìzhī.
examples.english: In the heavenly stems and earthly branches system, guǐ represents the tenth earthly branch.
